entry.title: Surface tension
entry.content:
Surface Tension

The term surface tension first appears in textbooks during middle or high school and is familiar even to those with little interest in science. Everyone knows surface tension, but not everyone understands surface tension. Surface tension

Fig. 1. Molecules in the bulk and at the liquid/gas interface. While the one in the bulk is in the presence of isotropic interactions with adjacent molecules, the one at the interface is in the absence of half its cohesive interactions.

Surface tension is a fascinating phenomenon that allows some insects to walk on water.

Fig. 2. A water strider using surface tension to walk on water. The insect's legs create dimples on the water surface without breaking through.
entry.summary: How far do you understand surface tension?
